overview_summary: Of the three Cochise County neighbors profiled, one (Amber Linendoll) has openly opposed a local development, while the other two have no documented stance on such projects. None hold major public office; one neighbor’s role in the Sheriff’s Office gives them moderate community influence, but overall influence among these landowners appears limited.

neighbors.name: Brenden & Amber Linendoll
neighbors.claims: Amber Linendoll is a Cochise County animal control officer who spoke out against a proposed commercial pet breeding facility, citing existing strains on local shelters [Arizona Daily Star](https://thisistucson.com/news/local/proposed-pet-breeding-facility-in-cochise-county-draws-opposition-from-tucson-beyond/article_6cdfdc18-b1ac-11eb-8792-37fe774e2a26.html). No records were found of Brenden Linendoll holding public roles or making land-use statements in the community [Arizona Daily Star](https://thisistucson.com/news/local/proposed-pet-breeding-facility-in-cochise-county-draws-opposition-from-tucson-beyond/article_6cdfdc18-b1ac-11eb-8792-37fe774e2a26.html).

approach_recommendations.engage: Connect via the Sheriff’s Office or animal welfare channels. Emphasize how the project will not burden local shelters or harm local animal conditions, addressing her documented concerns for community and animal well-being.

neighbors.name: Zane Daniel Ritenour
neighbors.claims: Zane Ritenour appears to be a local cattle rancher; a business at his address (ZR Cattle Company LLC in Benson) received $37,792 in USDA drought relief for Cochise County ranch operations in late 2023 [AZ Grazing Clearinghouse](https://azgrazingclearinghouse.org/arizona-livestock-forage-disaster-program-lfp-recipients-2022-2024/#:~:text=Cochise%20%7C%20ZR%20CATTLE%20COMPANY%20LLC%20%7C%20%2437%2C792%20%7C%2012%2F21%2F2023). The ZR Cattle Company is listed at 1855 N ZR Ranch Rd in Cochise County, indicating Ritenour’s involvement in a family ranch property [Manta](https://www.manta.com/c/mhh9phz/zr-cattle-company-llc). No public statements by Ritenour on development or energy projects could be located in local media as of this profile.

approach_recommendations.engage: Have an agricultural community representative reach out. Emphasize that the project will respect grazing land and livestock safety, and consider offering assurances or benefits that align with ranching interests.

neighbors.name: Robert H. & Pamela J. Bangle
neighbors.claims: Robert and Pamela Bangle own rural property in Cochise County, Arizona [Cochise County Assessor](https://www.cochise.az.gov/Departments/Assessor). They have no known public profile; no news reports or civic records were found that mention the Bangle family taking any position on local development issues.

approach_recommendations.engage: Proactively provide them with project information through a friendly, informal introduction. Since they have not been publicly active, ensure their questions or concerns are heard privately and addressed respectfully to build trust.
